technical-data.invention-title: Sonnenschutzanordnung und damit ausgestattete offene Dachkonstruktion
Shading assembly and open roof construction provided therewith
Ensemble d'occultation et construction de toit ouvert doté de celui-ci

description.p: The invention firstly relates to a shading assembly for shading an opening with at least two opposite opening sides in a structure, comprising a flexible shading member which is movable between a position completely covering said opening and a position at least partially freeing said opening.

A known shading assembly of such a type (also referred to as rollo), such as shown in DE-A-102004041385 or in EP-A-1852289, comprises a winding tube which is rotatably mounted in stationary mounts and onto which or from which the flexible shading member is wound. In such a type of shading assembly the two opposite opening sides of the opening are provided with guides embodied to guide longitudinal side edges of the shading member.
It is an object of the present invention to provide an alternative shading assembly.

Thus, in accordance with the present invention a shading assembly is presented which is characterized in that the flexible shading member is defined by two shading member parts which each have a first edge connected to one of said opposite opening sides and an opposite second edge, wherein said second edges of both shading member parts together define an elongate releasable connection device of the type further comprising a movable operating member which upon movement along said second edges connects or disconnects said second edges, wherein said opposite opening sides are provided with storage devices extending along the entire length of said opening sides for progressively receiving and housing the shading member parts when the operating member moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges, and for progressively dispensing the shading member parts when the operating member moves in a direction for connecting said second edges, and wherein each storage device is provided with a pressure member movable along said storage device for progressively pressing a respective one of the shading member parts into said storage device when the operating member moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges, which pressure members are connected to the operating member in a manner to be moved thereby.

The shading assembly according to the present invention does not comprise a winding tube. The shading member now is a two-part shading member with two shading member parts which will be detached from each other at the second edges and which will move apart and (by virtue of the pressure members) will move into the respective storage devices when the shading member (by an appropriate movement of the operating member in a first direction) is moved towards the position freeing the opening, and which at least, partly will move out of said storage devices towards each other to be connected again at said second edges when the shading member (by an appropriate opposite movement of the operating member) is moved towards the position covering the opening.

It is noted that the opening can have a shape with parallel opening sides (for example a rectangular shape) but it is conceivable too that the opening is differently shaped (e.g. circular, oval or triangular).

In one embodiment of the shading assembly according to the present invention the elongate releasable connection device is of the zipper type and the movable operating member defines a zipper slider. As an alternative the elongate releasable connection device is of the bag slide closure type and the movable operating member defines a bag slide closure slider. It should be noted however that it is conceivable too to provide other types of elongate releasable connection devices to be implemented in the present invention.

In another embodiment each pressure member is connected to the operating member by a rod capable of transmitting tensile forces and pressure forces, wherein each rod has two opposite ends pivotably connected to the operating member and respective pressure member, respectively, and wherein each rod has a variable length. Such a rod (or similar elongate member) will cause the pressure member to move when the operating member is operated, such that the pressure member then automatically will operate according to its envisaged function (specifically progressively pushing the shading member parts into the respective storage devices) without the need for separate driving means. The rod (and thus the pressure members and operating member relative to each other) are able to assume a position which is a-vourable for opening or closing the shading member. The variable length also will be of advantage when the opening does not have parallel opening sides.

It is possible that at least one of the rod, pressure member and operating member comprises limiting means for limiting the pivot motion of the rods between a straight position in which both rods extend substantially perpendicularly to the direction of movement of the operating member and in which both pressure members and operating member substantially are positioned in line with each other, and an inclined position in which the rods are inclined such that, as seen in a direction in which the operating member will move for disconnecting said second edges of the shading member parts, the operating member is positioned ahead of the pressure members. The so-called straight position will be reached when the operating member is moved to the position in which the shading member is completely covering the opening; in this position the rods assume a position with minimal length. The inclined position occurs at least when the operating member moves in the opposite direction; the rods then will assume a position with maximum length.

In one embodiment each rod comprises at least two rod parts received the one in the other in a telescoping manner for varying its length. But also other means are conceivable for varying the length of the rods (such as for example when the rods are articulated).
It is possible too that the pressure members and the operating member are interconnected in a fixed position relative to each other.

In another embodiment of the shading assembly according to the present invention it is further provided with covering members for at least partially covering the pressure members and operating member in the position of the flexible shading member completely covering the opening and in the position of the flexible shading member freeing said opening. Such covering members also will cover the sections of the shading member parts adjacent the pressure members and operating member, thus offering the assembly a neat appearance.
It is possible, then, that the covering members comprise two plate shaped, for example rectangular or triangular, members.

In a further embodiment one of said plate shaped members which is intended to cover the pressure members and operating member in the position of the flexible shading member completely covering the opening has a fixed position, whereas the other plate shaped member moves along with the pressure members and operating member. Both plate shaped members may have a complementary shape such that both plate shaped members may be positioned close to each other in the open position of the shading assembly.

When, in accordance with yet another embodiment of the shading assembly according to the present invention, the storage devices and pressure members are provided with cooperating guide projections and recesses for defining the relative movement between a storage device and respective pressure member, the relative position between those parts which is required for pushing the shading member parts into the storage devices will be maintained automatically.

Further it is possible that each storage device comprises a profiled member with a substantially U-shaped cross section defined by two legs connected by a bottom, wherein said two legs define an open side facing the opposite storage device, and wherein flexible retention means are provided for closing said open side. The flexible retention means allow the introduction of the shading member parts into and the removal from the cavity defined within the profiled members, while still being able to maintain the shading member parts within said cavity without the need for additional means.

It is possible that the flexible retention means comprise an array of flexible brush hairs extending from at least one leg towards the opposite leg along substantially the entire length of the profiled member, but as an alternative the flexible retention means may comprise a flexible lip extending from at least one leg towards the opposite leg along substantially the entire length of the profiled member.

In yet another embodiment the flexible retention means comprise a flexible strip which has a first end connected to a pressure member for movement along therewith. When the pressure member moves for pushing a shading member part into a profiled member, the flexible strip automatically follows the pressure member and closes the open side of the profiled member behind the pressure member for keeping the shading member part in the profiled member.

It is possible that the flexible strip has an opposite second end which is windable onto or from a winding mechanism or that the flexible strip has an opposite second end which is guided around a reversal roller and back into the profiled member (for example into a channel defined therein below/adjacent the bottom).
When, indeed, such a profiled member is provided as storage device the first edge of a shading member part could be connected to the bottom of said respective profiled member.

It is to be expected that in most embodiments of the shading assembly according to the present invention the elongate releasable connection device defined by said second edges of the shading member parts will extend along a straight line. As a result a symmetrical structure is obtained which also from an aesthetical point of view may be an advantage. It should be noted, however, that the above does not preclude the possibility that the elongate releasable connection device defined by said second edges of the shading member parts will extend along a curved line.

In a basic embodiment of the shading assembly according to the present invention the operating member and pressure members are devised to be moved manually. However, in a more sophisticated embodiment it is possible too that the shading assembly further comprises a drive member for moving the operating member and pressure members.

For example the drive member may engage the operating member and/or pressure member and may comprise one of a drive cable driven by a motor (e.g. an electric motor), a cylinder-piston assembly, a telescopic arm and a linkage arrangement.

In a specific embodiment of the shading assembly according to the present invention the structure is an open roof structure for a vehicle, the opening is a roof opening provided in a stationary roof part of said vehicle and the flexible shading member is a flexible sun screen.

In a second aspect the present invention relates to an open roof construction for a vehicle, comprising a roof opening in a stationary roof part of said vehicle and a sun screen assembly cooperating with said roof opening, which sun screen assembly comprises a shading assembly according to the present invention.

Referring to figure 1 part of a vehicle 1 is illustrated, comprising a stationary roof part 2 and a roof opening 3 provided in said stationary roof part. The roof opening 3 may be closed and opened by a movable panel 4, as is known per se. In the illustrated embodiment the roof opening 3 is rectangular and comprises two opposite parallel longitudinal side edges 5. It should be noted however that the roof opening may have other shapes too, such as for example oval, circular or triangular.

A sun screen assembly cooperating with said roof opening 3 and comprising a shading assembly according to the present invention has not been illustrated in figure 1 but will be elucidated while referring to the remaining figures.

Thus figure 2 schematically and in a perspective view illustrates part of a shading assembly for shading the substantially rectangular roof opening 3. Generally such a shading assembly will be located at a level below the movable panel 4 such as not to interfere with the movement thereof and will comprise two opposite parallel opening sides 6 which may be similar to, be part of or be positioned close to the side edges 5 of the roof opening 3. The shading assembly comprises a flexible shading member (or flexible sun screen) which is movable between a position completely covering said opening 3 and a position freeing said opening 3. The flexible shading member may comprise different kinds of cloth (for example transparent or not, different colours, thick or thin, etcetera)

The flexible shading member is defined by two shading member parts 7 and 8 which each have a first edge 9 (best seen in figure 3) connected to one of said opposite parallel opening sides and an opposite second edge 10, wherein said second edges 10 of both shading member parts 7,8 together define an elongate releasable connection device 11 of the type further comprising a movable operating member 12 which upon movement along said second edges 10 connects or disconnects said second edges.

The elongate releasable connection device 11 may be of the zipper type in which the movable operating member 12 defines a zipper slider. As an alternative the elongate releasable connection device 11 may be of the bag slide closure type in which the movable operating member 12 defines a bag slide closure slider. It is noted, however, that also other continuous closures of a similar type may be applied.

As illustrated in figure 2 the elongate releasable connection device 11 defined by said second edges 10 of the shading member parts 7,8 extends along a straight line and centrally in parallel to said opposite opening sides 6 of the opening 3. As an alternative, however, it also could extend along a curved line, as indicated schematically by the chain line 24 and/or not centrally.

The operating member 12 may be devised to be moved manually as is commonly known for a zipper slider. However, it is possible too that a drive member is provided for moving the operating member 12, such as a drive cable 25 driven by a motor, e.g. an electric motor 26. Other drive members will be explained later while referring to figures 10 and 11.

The said opposite parallel opening sides 6 are provided with profiled members 13 which define part of storage devices extending along the entire length of said opening sides for progressively receiving and housing the shading member parts 7,8 when the operating member 12 moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges 10 of the shading member parts, and for progressively dispensing the shading member parts 7,8 when the operating member 12 moves in a direction for connecting said second edges 10, as will be illustrated more clearly below while referring to figure 5.

Each storage device further is provided with a pressure member 14 which is movable along a respective profiled member 13 for progressively pressing a respective one of the shading member parts 7,8 into said profiled member when the operating member 12 moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges 10. Said pressure members 14 are connected to the operating member 12 as to be moved thereby in a manner to be described later. Already here it is emphasized, however, that the phrase "to be moved thereby" does not necessarily mean that the pressure member 14 and operating member 12 always move synchronously. Further it is noted, that a drive member also may engage the pressure members 14 in stead of the operating member 12.

Referring to figure 3 a cross section of profiled member 13 according to III-III in figure 2 is illustrated. Said profiled member 13 has a substantially U-shaped cross section defined by two legs 15,16 connected by a bottom 17. The profiled member 13 is oriented such that two legs 15,16 define an open side 18 facing the opposite profiled member (which is intended to receive the shading member part 8). Figure 3 clearly shows that the first edge 9 of shading member part 7 is connected to the bottom 17 of the respective profiled member 13 (in any appropriate manner, such as for example by sealing, gluing or by mechanical connection means).

Each leg 15,16 of the profiled members along substantially the entire length of said profiled members supports an array of flexible brush hairs 19 extending towards the opposite leg. These brush hairs 19 define retention means creating a barrier or curtain which is sufficiently flexible to allow the passage of the respective shading member part 7,8 when introducing it into or removing it from the profiled member 13, and which meanwhile is sufficiently strong to prevent the undesired release of the shading member part from said profiled member. Other types of retention means will be shown and described later while referring to figures 6-9.

The profiled member 13 and pressure member 14 are provided with cooperating guide projections and recesses for defining the relative movement between both parts. In the embodiment illustrated in figure 3 the pressure member 14 comprises projecting upper and lower ends 20, 21. which are received in recesses 22, 23 provided in the legs 15 and 16 of the profiled member 13 for allowing the pressure member 14 to slide longitudinally along the profiled member 13.

Specifically referring to figures 2-4 it is illustrated that each pressure member is connected to the operating member 12 by a rod 27 capable of transmitting tensile forces and pressure forces. Each rod 27 has two opposite ends pivotably connected to the operating member 12 and respective pressure member 14, respectively. In the illustrated embodiment each rod 27 comprises two rod parts 28 and 29 received the one in the other in a telescoping manner for varying the length of the rod 27. As will appear below, such a variation in length will occur automatically under influence of operating forces acting on each rod.

Figure 4, which is a view according to TV in figure 3, illustrates that the pressure member 14 comprises limiting means or stops 30,31 for limiting the pivot motion of the rod 27 between a straight position (as illustrated in figure 4 in dotted lines by rod part 29' and as illustrated in figure 5a) in which both rods 27 extend substantially perpendicularly to the opposite parallel opening sides 6 (or profiled members 13) of the opening 3 and in which both pressure members 14 and operating member 12 substantially are positioned in line with each other, and an inclined position (as illustrated in figure 4 in full lines by rod part 29 and as illustrated in figures 5b-d) in which the rods 27 are inclined such that, as seen in a direction in which the operating member 12 will move for disconnecting said second edges 10 of the shading member parts 7,8, the operating member 12 is positioned ahead of the pressure members 14. In both positions one of the stops 30,31 engages the rod part 29, but it will be clear that other equivalent limiting means may be applied. Thus it is conceivable too that the inclined position will be defined by the maximum amount in which the rods 27 are allowed to increase their length.

The operation of the shading assembly will be described while referring to figure 5. Figure 5a shows the shading assembly in a position for completely covering or closing the roof opening 3. The rods 27 are in the straight, aligned position and the shading member parts 7,8 are connected at their second edges 10 over the entire length of the shading assembly. In this position the rods 27 have assumed their minimal length.

Upon opening the shading assembly the operating member 12 is moved (manually or driven by a drive member, see figure 2) in a direction downwardly as seen in figure 5b. During the first stage of this movement of the operating member 12 the pressure members 14 remain in their initial position while the rods 27 pivot and are increased in length. During this first stage parts of the second edges 10' are disconnected from each other to make the shading member parts 7,8 less taut there and to offer these the opportunity to be pushed into the profiled members 13 when the pressure members 14 will start to move along with the operating member 12. The pressure members 14 will start to move when the rods 27 have reached the inclined position with maximum inclination (pivot angle).

Figure 5c shows a position in which the operating member 12 and pressure members 14 have moved a certain distance for partly opening the shading assembly. The parts of the shading assembly parts 7,8 behind (in figure 5c above) the pressure members 14 have been pushed through the open sides 18 (figure 3) into the internal cavity of the profiled members 13 by virtue of the pressure members and are kept safe therein by the brush hairs 19 (see figure 3). It should be noted that the leading edge of the pressure members 14 could be shaped for engaging and guiding the shading member parts 7,8 in a most effective manner. Also other parts of the structure, such as for example the rods 27, could comprise guide provisions for enhancing the proper movement of said shading member parts into (and/or out of) the profiled members 13.
In figure 5d the operating member 12 and thus the pressure members 14 (almost) have reached their extreme positions for completely freeing or opening the roof opening 3.

For again closing the shading assembly, starting from the position illustrated in figure 5d, the operating member 12 is moved in the opposite direction. The pressure members 1.4 will move along with the operating member 12, partly due to forces transmitted by the rods 27 and partly because the shading member parts 7,8 are pulled out of the profiled members 13 and thus engage the leading edge of said pressure members 14 while generating a thrust in the direction of movement (upwardly as seen in figure 5c).

Upon again reaching the position illustrated in figure 5b the pressure members will stop and a further movement of the operating member towards its end position illustrated in figure 5a will pivot the rods to the straight (and shortened) position of figure 5a in which the shading member parts 7,8 are completely taut and the shading assembly is entirely closed.

Figures 6 and 7 show alternative embodiments of the retention means, which in figure 6 comprise a single flexible lip 32 extending from the lower leg 15 upwards towards the upper leg 16. The rod 27, in this embodiment, is attached to the pressure member 14 at an elevated position compared to the embodiment illustrated in figure 3. In figure 7 two flexible lips 33 and 34 extending from the legs 15 and 16, respectively, are shown. In either embodiment the lips 32, 33 and 34 generally will extend along substantially the entire length of the profiled members 13.

Figure 8 shows an embodiment in which the flexible retention means comprise a flexible strip 35 which has a first end 36 connected to a pressure member 14 for movement along therewith. Said flexible strip 35 has an opposite second end 37 which may be windable onto or from a winding mechanism (for example a winding spool not illustrated).

In the embodiment according to figure 9 the flexible strip 35 has an opposite second end 37 which is guided around a reversal roller 38 and back into the profiled member 13, for example into a guiding channel 39 thereof adjacent the bottom 17 (only represented for one profiled member 13 but also present at the other). Movement of the pressure member 14 moves the second strip end 37 in to and out of said guiding channel 39.

Figure 10 shows an alternative for the drive member, which here is a telescopic arm (or cylinder-piston assembly) 39 engaging the operating member 12. In figure 11 a linkage arrangement 40 is provided engaging the operating member 12. In either embodiment the drive means also or alternatively could engage the pressure members 14.

Whereas the previous embodiments use pivoting rods 27 connecting the pressure members 14 to the operating member 12, figure 12 shows an alternative embodiment in which the pressure members 14 and operating member 12 are integrated into a single piece and have a fixed, position relative to each other. Of course this position may differ from the illustrated one (for example these parts may be positioned on a straight line).

Finally figure 13 shows plate shaped covering members 41 and 42. Covering member 41 is in a position for covering the pressure members 14 and operating member 12 (and corresponding free edges of the shading member parts 7 and 8) when the shading assembly closes the opening, and covering member 42 is in a position for covering the pressure members 14 and operating member 12 when the shading assembly is in an open position freeing the opening. In stead of a fixed covering member 41 a movable covering member (indicated by dotted lines) 41' moving along with the operating member 12 and pressure members 14 may be used. Further the covering members 41 and 42 as illustrated have a complementary triangular shape, but they also may have different shapes, complementary or not (illustrated for example by chain line 41" as rectangular).
The covering member 41 may be provided with guide provisions (not illustrated) for the shading member parts 7,8.

The invention is not limited to the embodiments described before which may be varied widely within the scope of the invention as defined by the appending claims. For example the rod parts 28 and 29 can be spring loaded towards a position for a maximum length of the rod 27.

claim.claim-text: Abschattungsvorrichtung zum Abschatten einer Öffnung (3) mit zumindest zwei gegenüberliegenden Öffnungsseiten (5) in einer Struktur, aufweisend ein flexibles Abschattungselement (7,8), das zwischen einer Position, die Öffnung komplett abdeckend, und einer Position, die Öffnung zumindest teilweise freigebend, bewegbar ist, dadurch gekennzeichnet, dass das flexible Abschattungselement von zwei Abschattungselement-Teilen (7, 8) definiert ist, von denen jedes einen ersten Rand (9), der mit einer der gegenüberliegenden Öffnungsseiten (5) verbunden ist, und einen gegenüberliegenden, zweiten Rand (10) aufweist, wobei die zweiten Ränder der zwei Abschattungselement-Teile zusammen eine längliche, lösbare Verbindungseinrichtung (11) definieren, die von dem Typ ist, der ferner ein bewegbares Betätigungselement (12) aufweist, das bei der Bewegung entlang der zweiten Ränder (10) die zweiten Ränder verbindet oder trennt, wobei die gegenüberliegenden Öffnungsseiten (5) mit Aufnahmevorrichtungen (13) bereitgestellt sind, die sich entlang der gesamten Länge der Öffnungsseiten erstrecken, um die Abschattungselement-Teile (7, 8) progressiv aufzunehmen und unterzubringen, wenn sich das Betätigungselement (12) in einer Richtung zum Trennen der zweiten Ränder (10) bewegt, und um die Abschattungselement-Teile (7, 8) progressiv auszugeben, wenn sich das Betätigungselement (12) in eine Richtung zum Verbinden der zweiten Ränder (10) bewegt, wobei jede Aufnahmevorrichtung (13) mit einem Druckelement (14) bereitgestellt ist, das entlang der Aufnahmevorrichtung bewegbar ist, um ein jeweiliges Abschattungselement-Teil (7, 8) progressiv in die Aufnahmevorrichtung hinein zu drücken, wenn sich das Betätigungselement (12) in eine Richtung zum Trennen der zweiten Ränder bewegt, wobei die Druckelemente (14) so mit dem Betätigungselement (12) verbunden sind, dass sie mittels dieses bewegt werden.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 1, wobei die längliche, lösbare Verbindungseinrichtung (11) vom Reißverschluss-Typ ist und das bewegbare Betätigungselement (12) einen Reißverschluss-Schieber definiert.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 1, wobei die längliche, lösbare Verbindungseinrichtung (11) vom Tüte-Schiebeverschluss-Typ ist und das bewegbare Betätigungselement (12) einen Tüte-Schiebeverschluss-Schieber definiert.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei jedes Druckelement (14) mittels einer Stange (27), die Zug- und Druckkräfte übertragen kann, mit dem Betätigungselement (12) verbunden ist, wobei jede Stange (27) zwei gegenüberliegende Enden hat, die schwenkbar mit dem Betätigungselement (12) bzw. dem jeweiligen Druckelement (14) verbunden sind, und wobei jede Stange eine variierbare Länge hat.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 4, wobei zumindest eines von der Stange (27), dem Druckelement (14) und dem Betätigungselement (12) Begrenzungsmittel (30, 31) aufweist zum Begrenzen der Schwenkbewegung der Stangen zwischen einer geraden Position, in der sich beide Stangen (27) im Wesentlichen rechtwinklig zu der Richtung der Bewegung des Betätigungselements erstrecken und in der die beiden Druckelemente (14) und die Betätigungselemente (12) im Wesentlichen in Linie miteinander positioniert sind, und einer geneigten Position, in der die Stangen (27) so geneigt sind, dass, in einer Richtung betrachtet, in der sich das Betätigungselement (12) zum Trennen der zweiten Ränder (10) der Abschattungselement-Teile (7,8) bewegen wird, das Betätigungselement (12) vor den Druckelementen (14) positioniert ist.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 4 oder 5, wobei jede Stange (27) zumindest zwei Stange-Teile (28, 29) aufweist, von denen eines in dem anderen zum Variieren der Länge davon teleskopartig aufgenommen ist.
Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 3, wobei die Druckelemente (14) und das Betätigungselement (12) in einer relativ zueinander festen Position miteinander verbunden sind.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, ferner bereitgestellt mit Abdeckungselementen (41, 42) zum zumindest teilweisen Abdecken der Druckelemente (14) und des Betätigungselements (12) in der Position, in der das flexible Abschattungselement die Öffnung (3) vollständig abdeckt, und in der Position, in der das flexible Abschattungselement die Öffnung freigibt.
Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 8, wobei die Abdeckungselemente (41, 42) zwei plattenförmige, zum Beispiel rechteckige oder dreieckige, Elemente aufweisen.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 9, wobei eines der plattenförmigen Elemente (41), das dazu gedacht ist, die Druckelemente (14) und das Betätigungselement (12) in der Position, in der das flexible Abschattungselement (7,8) die Öffnung (3) vollständig abdeckt, abzudecken, eine feste Position hat, wobei sich das andere plattenförmige Element (41') zusammen mit den Druckelementen und dem Betätigungselement bewegt.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Aufnahmevorrichtungen (13) und die Druckelemente (14) mit zusammenwirkenden Führungsvorsprüngen (20, 21) und Aussparungen (22, 23) zum Definieren der relativen Bewegung zwischen einer Aufnahmevorrichtung und einem jeweiligen Druckelement bereitgestellt sind.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei jede Aufnahmevorrichtung ein Profil-Teil (13) mit einem im Wesentlichen U-förmigen Querschnitt, der definiert ist mittels zweier Schenkel (15, 16), die durch einen Boden (17) verbunden sind, aufweist, wobei die beiden Schenkel eine offene Seite definieren, die zu der gegenüberliegenden Aufnahmevorrichtung zeigt, und wobei flexible Rückhaltemittel (19, 32-35) zum Schließen der offenen Seite bereitgestellt sind.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 12, wobei die flexiblen Rückhaltemittel eine Anordnung von flexiblen Bürsten-Haaren, die sich von zumindest einem Schenkel (15, 16) aus zu dem gegenüberliegenden Schenkel (16, 15) hin entlang der im Wesentlichen gesamten Länge des Profil-Teils (13) erstrecken, aufweisen.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 12, wobei die flexiblen Rückhaltemittel eine flexible Lippe (32-34), die sich von zumindest einem Schenkel (15, 16) aus zu dem gegenüberliegenden Schenkel (16, 15) hin entlang der im Wesentlichen gesamten Länge des Profil-Teils (13) erstreckt, aufweisen.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 12, wobei die flexiblen Rückhaltemittel einen flexiblen Streifen (35), der ein erstes Ende (36) aufweist, das mit einem Druckelement (14) zur Bewegung mit diesem verbunden ist, aufweisen.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 15, wobei der flexible Streifen (35) ein gegenüberliegendes zweites Ende (37), das auf einen Windemechanismus aufgewunden oder davon abgewunden werden kann, aufweist.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 15, wobei der flexible Streifen (35) ein gegenüberliegendes zweites Ende (37), das um eine Umkehrolle (38) und zurück in das Profil-Teil (13) hinein geführt wird, aufweist.
Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der Ansprüche 12 bis 17, wobei der erste Rand (9) eines Abschattungselement-Teils (7,8) mit dem Boden (17) eines jeweiligen Profil-Teils (13) verbunden ist.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei sich die längliche, lösbare Verbindungseinrichtung (11), die von den zweiten Rändern (10) der Abschattungsvorrichtung-Teile (7,8) definiert ist, entlang einer geraden Linie erstreckt.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der Ansprüche 1 bis 18, wobei sich die längliche, lösbare Verbindungseinrichtung (11), die von den zweiten Rändern (10) der Abschattungsvorrichtung-Teile (7,8) definiert ist, entlang einer gekrümmten Linie erstreckt.
Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Betätigungselement (12) und die Druckelemente (14) eingerichtet sind, um manuell bewegt zu werden.
Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, ferner aufweisend ein Antriebselement (25, 26; 39; 40) zum Bewegen des Betätigungselements (12) und der Druckelemente (14).

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß Anspruch 22, wobei das Antriebselement mit dem Betätigungselement und/oder dem Druckelement im Eingriff ist und eines von einem Antriebsseil (25), das von einem Motor (26) (z.B. einem Elektromotor) angetrieben wird, einer Zylinderkolben-Vorrichtung, einem Teleskoparm (29) und einer Verbindungsanordnung (40) aufweist.

Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei die Struktur eine Offendach-Struktur für ein Fahrzeug (1) ist, wobei die Öffnung eine Dachöffnung (3) ist, die in einem feststehenden Teil (2) des Daches des Fahrzeugs bereitgestellt ist, und wobei das flexible Abschattungselement (7, 8) einen flexiblen Sonnenschutz ist.

Offendach-Konstruktion für ein Fahrzeug (1), aufweisend eine Dachöffnung (3) in einem feststehenden Teil (2) eines Daches des Fahrzeugs sowie eine Sonnenschutzvorrichtung, die mit der Dachöffnung zusammenwirkt, wobei die Sonnenschutzvorrichtung eine Abschattungsvorrichtung gemäß einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche aufweist.

Shading assembly for shading an opening (3) with at least two opposite opening sides (5) in a structure, comprising a flexible shading member (7,8) which is movable between a position completely covering said opening and a position at least partially freeing said opening, characterized in that the flexible shading member is defined by two shading member parts (7,8) which each have a first edge (9) connected to one of said opposite opening sides (5) and an opposite second edge (10), wherein said second edges of both shading member parts together define an elongate releasable connection device (11) of the type further comprising a movable operating member (12) which upon movement along said second edges (10) connects or disconnects said second edges, wherein said opposite opening sides (5) are provided with storage devices (13) extending along the entire length of said opening sides for progressively receiving and housing the shading member parts (7,8) when the operating member (12) moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges (10), and for progressively dispensing the shading member parts (7,8) when the operating member (12) moves in a direction for connecting said second edges (10), and wherein each storage device (13) is provided with a pressure member (14) movable along said storage device for progressively pressing a respective one of the shading member parts (7,8) into said storage device when the operating member moves in a direction for disconnecting said second edges, which pressure members (14) are connected to the operating member (12) in a manner to be moved thereby.
Shading assembly according to claim 1, wherein the elongate releasable connection device (11) is of the zipper type and the movable operating member (12) defines a zipper slider.

Shading assembly according to claim 1, wherein the elongate releasable connection device (11) is of the bag slide closure type and the movable operating member (12) defines a bag slide closure slider.

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein each pressure member (14) is connected to the operating member (12) by a rod (27) capable of transmitting tensile forces and pressure forces, wherein each rod (27) has two opposite ends pivotably connected to the operating member (12) and respective pressure member (14), respectively, and wherein each rod has a variable length.

Shading assembly according to claim 4, wherein at least one of the rod (27), pressure member (14) and operating member (12) comprises limiting means (30,31) for limiting the pivot motion of the rods between a straight position in which both rods (27) extend substantially perpendicularly to the direction of movement of the operating member and in which both pressure members (14) and operating member (12) substantially are positioned in line with each other, and an inclined position in which the rods (27) are inclined such that, as seen in a direction in which the operating member (12) will move for disconnecting said second edges (10) of the shading member parts (7,8), the operating member (12) is positioned ahead of the pressure members (14).
Shading assembly according to claim 4 or 5, wherein each rod (27) comprises at least two rod parts (28,29) received the one in the other in a telescoping manner for varying its length.
Shading assembly according to any of the claims 1-3, wherein the pressure members (14) and the operating member (12) are interconnected in a fixed position relative to each other.

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, further provided with covering members (41,42) for at least partially covering the pressure members (14) and operating member (12) in the position of the flexible shading member completely covering the opening (3) and in the position of the flexible shading member freeing said opening.
Shading assembly according to claim 8, wherein the covering members (41,42) comprise two plate shaped, for example rectangular or triangular, members.

Shading assembly according to claim 9, wherein one of said plate shaped members (41) which is intended to cover the pressure members (14) and operating member (12) in the position of the flexible shading member (7,8) completely covering the opening (3) has a fixed position, whereas the other plate shaped member (41') moves along with the pressure members and operating member.

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein the storage devices (13) and pressure members (14) are provided with cooperating guide projections (20,21) and recesses (22,23) for defining the relative movement between a storage device and respective pressure member.

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein each storage device comprises a profiled member (13) with a substantially U-shaped cross section defined by two legs (15,16) connected by a bottom (17), wherein said two legs define an open side facing the opposite storage device, and wherein flexible retention means (19,32-35) are provided for closing said open side.

Shading assembly according to claim 12, wherein the flexible retention means comprise an array of flexible brush hairs (19) extending from at least one leg (15,16) towards the opposite leg (16,15) along substantially the entire length of the profiled member (13).

Shading assembly according to claim 12, wherein the flexible retention means comprise a flexible lip (32-34) extending from at least one leg (15,16) towards the opposite leg (16,15) along substantially the entire length of the profiled member (13).

Shading assembly according to claim 12, wherein the flexible retention means comprise a flexible strip (35) which has a first end (36) connected to a pressure member (14) for movement along therewith.
Shading assembly according to claim 15, wherein the flexible strip (35) has an opposite second end (37) which is windable onto or from a winding mechanism.
Shading assembly according to claim 15, wherein the flexible strip (35) has an opposite second end (37) which is guided around a reversal roller (38) and back into the profiled member (13).
Shading assembly according to any of the claims 12-17, wherein the first edge (9) of a shading member part (7,8) is connected to the bottom (17) of a respective profiled member (13).

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein the elongate releasable connection device (11) defined by said second edges (10) of the shading member parts (7,8) extends along a straight line.

Shading assembly according to any of the claims 1-18, wherein the elongate releasable connection device (11) defined by said second edges (10) of the shading member parts (7,8) extends along a curved line.
Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein the operating member (12) and pressure members (14) are devised to be moved manually.
Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, further comprising a drive member (25,26;39;40) for moving the operating member (12) and pressure members (14).

Shading assembly according to claim 22, wherein the drive member engages the operating member and/or pressure member and comprises one of a drive cable (25) driven by a motor (26)(e.g. an electric motor), a cylinder-piston assembly, a telescopic arm (39) and a linkage arrangement (40).

Shading assembly according to any of the previous claims, wherein the structure is an open roof structure for a vehicle (1), the opening is a roof opening (3) provided in a stationary roof part (2) of said vehicle and the flexible shading member (7,8) is a flexible sun screen.

Open roof construction for a vehicle (1), comprising a roof opening (3) in a stationary roof part (2) of said vehicle and a sun screen assembly cooperating with said roof opening, which sun screen assembly comprises a shading assembly according to any of the previous claims.

Ensemble d'occultation pour occulter une ouverture (3) avec au moins deux côtés d'ouverture opposés (5) dans une structure, comprenant un organe d'occultation flexible (7, 8) qui est mobile entre une position recouvrant complètement ladite ouverture et une position libérant au moins partiellement ladite ouverture, caractérisé en ce que l'organe d'occultation flexible est défini par deux parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) qui ont chacune un premier bord (9) connecté à l'un desdits côtés d'ouverture opposés (5) et un deuxième bord opposé (10), dans lequel lesdits deuxièmes bords des deux parties d'organe d'occultation définissent ensemble un dispositif allongé de connexion amovible (11) du type comprenant en outre un organe de fonctionnement mobile (12) qui, lors d'un déplacement le long desdits deuxièmes bords (10), connecte ou déconnecte lesdits deuxièmes bords, dans lequel lesdits côtés d'ouverture opposés (5) sont pourvus de dispositifs de stockage (13) s'étendant sur toute la longueur desdits côtés d'ouverture pour progressivement recevoir et loger les parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) lorsque l'organe de fonctionnement (12) se déplace dans une direction pour déconnecter lesdits deuxièmes bords (10), et pour progressivement distribuer les parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) lorsque l'organe de fonctionnement (12) se déplace dans une direction pour connecter lesdits deuxièmes bords (10), et dans lequel chaque dispositif de stockage (13) est pourvu d'un organe de pression (14) mobile le long dudit dispositif de stockage pour progressivement presser l'une respective des parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) dans ledit dispositif de stockage lorsque l'organe de fonctionnement se déplace dans une direction pour déconnecter lesdits deuxièmes bords, les organes de pression (14) sont connectés à l'organe de fonctionnement (12) de manière à être déplacés par celui-ci.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 1, dans lequel le dispositif allongé de connexion amovible (11) est du type à fermeture éclair et l'organe de fonctionnement mobile (12) définit un curseur de fermeture éclair.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 1, dans lequel le dispositif allongé de connexion amovible (11) est du type à fermeture à glissière de sac et l'organe de fonctionnement mobile (12) définit un curseur de fermeture à glissière de sac.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel chaque organe de pression (14) est connecté à l'organe de fonctionnement (12) par une tige (27) capable de transmettre des forces de traction et des forces de pression, dans lequel chaque tige (27) comporte deux extrémités opposées connectées respectivement à l'organe de fonctionnement (12) et à l'organe de pression (14) respectif de façon à pouvoir pivoter, et dans lequel chaque tige a une longueur variable.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 4, dans lequel au moins l'un de la tige (27), l'organe de pression (14) et l'organe de fonctionnement (12) comprend un moyen de limitation (30, 31) pour limiter le mouvement pivotant des tiges entre une position droite à laquelle les deux tiges (27) s'étendent sensiblement perpendiculairement à la direction de déplacement de l'organe de fonctionnement et à laquelle les deux organes de pression (14) et l'organe de fonctionnement (12) sont sensiblement positionnés en ligne l'un avec l'autre, et une position inclinée à laquelle les tiges (27) sont inclinées de sorte que, en vue dans une direction dans laquelle l'organe de fonctionnement (12) se déplace pour déconnecter lesdits deuxièmes bords (10) des parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8), l'organe de fonctionnement (12) soit positionné à l'avant des organes de pression (14).

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 4 ou 5, dans lequel chaque tige (27) comprend au moins deux parties de tige (28, 29) reçues l'une dans l'autre d'une manière télescopique pour en varier la longueur.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 3, dans lequel les organes de pression (14) et l'organe de fonctionnement (12) sont interconnectés à une position fixe l'un par rapport à l'autre.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, pourvu en outre d'organes de recouvrement (41, 42) pour recouvrir au moins partiellement les organes de pression (14) et l'organe de fonctionnement (12) à la position dans laquelle l'organe d'occultation flexible recouvre complètement l'ouverture (3) et à la position dans laquelle l'organe d'occultation flexible libère ladite ouverture.
Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 8, dans lequel les organes de recouvrement (41, 42) comprennent deux organes en forme de plaque, par exemple rectangulaire ou triangulaire.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 9, dans lequel l'un desdits organes en forme de plaque (41) qui est destiné à recouvrir les organes de pression (14) et l'organe de fonctionnement (12) à la position dans laquelle l'organe d'occultation flexible (7, 8) recouvrant complètement l'ouverture (3) a une position fixe, alors que l'autre organe en forme de plaque (41') se déplace avec les organes de pression et l'organe de fonctionnement.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel les dispositifs de stockage (13) et les organes de pression (14) sont pourvus de saillies de guidage en coopération (20, 21) et d'évidements (22, 23) pour définir le déplacement relatif entre un dispositif de stockage et un organe de pression respectif.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel chaque dispositif de stockage comprend un organe profilé (13) ayant une coupe transversale sensiblement en forme de U définie par deux pieds (15, 16) connectés par un fond (17), dans lequel lesdits deux pieds définissent un côté ouvert faisant face au dispositif de stockage opposé, et dans lequel un moyen de rétention flexible (19, 32-35) est fourni pour fermer ledit côté ouvert.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 12, dans lequel le moyen de rétention flexible comprend un réseau de poils de brosse flexibles (19) s'étendant à partir d'au moins un pied (15, 16) vers le pied opposé (16, 15) sur sensiblement toute la longueur de l'organe profilé (13).

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 12, dans lequel le moyen de rétention flexible comprend une lèvre flexible (32-34) s'étendant à partir d'au moins un pied (15, 16) vers le pied opposé (16, 15) sur sensiblement toute la longueur de l'organe profilé (13).

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 12, dans lequel le moyen de rétention flexible comprend une bande flexible (35) qui a une première extrémité (36) connectée à un organe de pression (14) pour se déplacer avec celui-ci.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 15, dans lequel la bande flexible (35) a une deuxième extrémité opposée (37) qui peut être enroulée sur un mécanisme d'enroulement ou à partir de celui-ci.

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 15, dans lequel la bande flexible (35) a une deuxième extrémité opposée (37) qui est guidée autour d'un rouleau d'inversion (38) et de retour dans l'organe profilé (13).

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications 12 à 17, dans lequel le premier bord (9) d'une partie d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) est connecté au fond (17) d'un organe profilé (13) respectif.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel le dispositif allongé de connexion libérable (11) défini par lesdits deuxièmes bords (10) des parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) s'étend le long d'une ligne droite.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 18, dans lequel le dispositif allongé de connexion libérable (11) défini par lesdits deuxièmes bords (10) des parties d'organe d'occultation (7, 8) s'étend le long d'une ligne incurvée.
Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel l'organe de fonctionnement (12) et les organes de pression (14) sont conçus pour être déplacés manuellement.

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, comprenant en outre un organe d'entraînement (25, 26 ; 39 ; 40) pour déplacer l'organe de fonctionnement (12) et les organes de pression (14).

Ensemble d'occultation selon la revendication 22, dans lequel l'organe d'entraînement se met en prise avec l'organe de fonctionnement et/ou l'organe de pression et comprend l'un d'un câble d'entraînement (25) entraîné par un moteur (26) (par exemple, un moteur électrique), un ensemble de cylindre-piston, un bras télescopique (39) et un agencement de timonerie (40).

Ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel la structure est une structure de toit ouvrant pour un véhicule (1), l'ouverture est une ouverture de toit (3) fournie dans une partie de toit immobile (2) dudit véhicule et l'organe d'occultation flexible (7, 8) est un écran pare-soleil flexible.

Construction de toit ouvrant pour un véhicule (1), comprenant une ouverture de toit (3) dans une partie de toit immobile (2) dudit véhicule et un ensemble d'écran pare-soleil coopérant avec ladite ouverture de toit, lequel ensemble d'écran pare-soleil comprend un ensemble d'occultation selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes.
